Key Arguments: The government should not be the final arbiter of truth or have the power to censor information.
Misinformation should be countered by free exchange of ideas, not government control.
The bill is authoritarian and contrary to liberal democratic traditions.
Governments themselves have been sources of misinformation, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The bill is a strategy to control the narrative and suppress dissenting voices.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and mainstream media
Historical examples of truth emerging from dissent
Notable Quotes: I object to the general principle of the Bill, that our Government or governments are to be given the role of final arbiters of ‘Truth’ with power to censor and control what is accessed by citizens.
The best antidote to ‘misinformation’ or ‘disinformation’ is the free flow of information and debate in a truly free public square.
This Bill is Orwellian. It has been said that ‘misinformation is the word they use to shut you up.’
